TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit StylusPlugIn extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a plug-in that can be added to a control's <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.StylusPlugIns%2A> property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The StylusPlugIn allows you to manipulate objects on separate threads. Separate threads are used so that the ink still renders as the tablet pen inputs data even if the application is doing something else. To intercept stylus points from the hardware, create a class that inherits from the StylusPlugIn class. The StylusPlugIn class has the following methods that you can override to manipulate objects on a thread in the pen thread pool. - - - - - The pen's input is routed to an element's StylusPlugIn on the pen thread. Since accurate hit-testing cannot be performed on the pen thread, some elements might occasionally receive stylus input intended for other elements. If you need to make sure the input was routed correctly before performing an operation, subscribe to and perform the operation in the , , or method. These methods are invoked by the main application thread after accurate hit-testing has been performed. To subscribe to these methods, call the method in the method that occurs on the pen thread. For example, if you call in , the occurs. > [!NOTE] > If you use a StylusPlugIn inside a control, you should test the plug-in and control extensively to make sure they do not throw any unintended exceptions. ## XAML Text Usage This class is not typically used in XAML. ## Examples The following example creates a custom StylusPlugIn that constrains the ink to a certain area on the control. [!code-cs[StylusPluginSamples#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/StylusPluginSamples/FilterPlugin.cs#1)] [!code-vb[StylusPluginSamples#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/StylusPluginSamples/FilterPlugin.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets the cached bounds of the element.
Docs.value: The cached bounds of the element.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.StylusPlugIn> caches the bounds of its element to perform hit testing.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.DynamicRenderer>, which inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.StylusPlugIn>, uses an <xref:System.Windows.Media.ImageBrush> to render a stroke. This brush partially draws the image file specified by `imageFile`.
[!code-vb[StylusPluginSamples#17](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/StylusPluginSamples/ImageRenderer.vb#17)] [!code-cs[StylusPluginSamples#17](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/StylusPluginSamples/ImageRenderer.cs#17)]

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsActiveForInput { get; }
.property instance bool IsActiveForInput

Docs.summary: Gets whether the is able to accept input.
Docs.value: if the is able to accept input; otherwise .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following conditions must be met for the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.StylusPlugIn> to accept input:
- The <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.StylusPlugIn> is a member of a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.StylusPlugInCollection>.
- The <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.StylusPlugIn.Element%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.StylusPlugIn> is visible and enabled.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to override the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.StylusPlugIn.OnIsActiveForInputChanged%2A> method.
[!code-vb[StylusPluginSamples#18](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/StylusPluginSamples/CustomDynamicRenderer.vb#18)] [!code-cs[StylusPluginSamples#18](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/StylusPluginSamples/CustomDynamicRenderer.cs#18)]

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void OnStylusDown (System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.RawStylusInput rawStylusInput);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnStylusDown(class System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.RawStylusInput rawStylusInput) cil managed

Docs.param: A that contains information about input from the pen.
Docs.summary: Occurs on a thread in the pen thread pool when the tablet pen touches the digitizer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method occurs on a pen thread, so minimize work in this method to avoid impacting performance.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to override the OnStylusDown method. To create a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.StylusPlugIn> that restricts ink to a certain area, see the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.StylusPlugIn> overview.
[!code-cs[StylusPluginSamples#8](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/StylusPluginSamples/FilterPlugin.cs#8)] [!code-vb[StylusPluginSamples#8](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/StylusPluginSamples/FilterPlugin.vb#8)]

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void OnStylusDownProcessed (object callbackData, bool targetVerified);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnStylusDownProcessed(object callbackData, bool targetVerified) cil managed

Docs.param: The object that the application passed to the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.RawStylusInput.NotifyWhenProcessed%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
if the pen's input was correctly routed to the ; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Occurs on the application UI (user interface) thread when the tablet pen touches the digitizer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks To subscribe to this method, call <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.RawStylusInput.NotifyWhenProcessed%2A> in the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.StylusPlugIn.OnStylusDown%2A> method.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.StylusPlugIn> that checks for the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture> gesture. The <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.StylusPlugIn> calls <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.RawStylusInput.NotifyWhenProcessed%2A> in <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.StylusPlugIn.OnStylusUp%2A> to subscribe to the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.StylusPlugIn.OnStylusUpProcessed%2A> method, which is called from the application UI thread. The relationship between <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.StylusPlugIn.OnStylusDown%2A> and on OnStylusDownProcessed is identical.
[!code-cs[StylusPluginSamples#12](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/StylusPluginSamples/RecognizerPlugin.cs#12)] [!code-vb[StylusPluginSamples#12](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/StylusPluginSamples/RecognizerPlugin.vb#12)]

if the pen's input was correctly routed to the ; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks To subscribe to this method, call <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.RawStylusInput.NotifyWhenProcessed%2A> in the <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.StylusPlugIn.OnStylusUp%2A> method
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.StylusPlugIn> that checks for the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture> gesture. The <xref:System.Windows.Input.StylusPlugIns.StylusPlugIn> checks for the gesture in the OnStylusUpProcessed method, which is called from the application UI thread.
